Through original programming, documentaries, and expert-led discussions, MHTN aims to increase awareness, provide valuable information, and encourage open conversations about mental well-being.

programme.title: Quo Vadis TV
programme.desc: Quo Vadis TV is committed to sharing the Biblical message in a way that makes Christian living practical, realistic, and attainable. Our theme is summarized the question: "where are you going?" Our Aim with this inquiry is to help people find orientation and find the path back to God.

Our theme is summarized the question: "where are you going?" Our Aim with this inquiry is to help people find orientation and find the path back to God.

programme.title: Camp Woodward
programme.desc: For most children, summer camp is a time of singing songs by the fire, creating gimp bracelets in arts and crafts, and munching on s'mores. For a special breed of camper, however, it's the season for practicing a 180 G-Turn or mastering a 50/50 grind. "Camp Woodward" follows young daredevils-in-training into the Pennsylvania Dutch countryside, where action-sports counselors and visiting guest professionals help turn these skateboarding and BMX students into the Tony Hawks and Ryan Nyquists of tomorrow.

programme.title: The Adventures of Danny & the Dingo
programme.desc: Professional snowboarder Danny Kass, winner of two Olympic silver medals and even more Winter X Games bling, teams up with Australian colleague Luke "the Dingo" Trembath for a rollicking sports travel series. If there's fresh powder and a steep incline, chances are these two fun-loving guys and their entourage are speeding there in their customized RV, eagerly awaiting the chance to display their talents. While the emphasis is on snowboarding, the energetic hosts also dabble in any other extreme sport that may come their way, as well as the usual off-hour, juvenile high jinks.

programme.title: The Captain & Casey Show
programme.desc: Oddball anchormen Jeff "The Captain" Carlson and Chris Casey share the latest news in the world of skateboarding in this on-the-cheap, bizarro broadcast designed to appeal to the sensibilities of today's young skaters. Set in what appears to be a wood-paneled basement, our two sick hosts discuss their favorite sport, with top dogs of the skateboard circuit dropping in for a visit. Posers like Mom and Dad might find these freewheeling goofballs a bit sketchy, but their teenage kids will be stoked.

programme.title: The Captain & Casey Show
programme.desc: Oddball anchormen Jeff "The Captain" Carlson and Chris Casey share the latest news in the world of skateboarding in this on-the-cheap, bizarro broadcast designed to appeal to the sensibilities of today's young skaters. Set in what appears to be a wood-paneled basement, our two sick hosts discuss their favorite sport, with top dogs of the skateboard circuit dropping in for a visit. Posers like Mom and Dad might find these freewheeling goofballs a bit sketchy, but their teenage kids will be stoked.

programme.title: Foul Play

programme.title: Foul Play
programme.desc: Dennis Rodman donne un coup de pied, Steph Curry est le porte-parole de la folie, Metta World Peace fait preuve de malice et la vie et les crimes d'Allen Iverson.

programme.title: Foul Play
programme.desc: Le carton rouge de David Beckham lors de la Coupe du monde 1998, Sepp Blatter et la corruption de la FIFA, ainsi que le club de football argentin Boca Juniors qui traverse un territoire ennemi en bus.

programme.title: It Is Written
programme.desc: "It Is Written" has been a staple on American television since premiering in 1956. The weekly program, currently hosted by John Bradshaw, applies timeless truths to everyday life, with many episodes dealing with issues such as loneliness, fear, low self-esteem and spiritual principles. With its straightforward, uplifting presentations, the program aims to inspire and encourage people of all faiths and creeds. Founded by George Vandeman, "It Is Written" was the first religious telecast to air in color.

programme.title: Wheel of Fortune
programme.desc: Contestants guess hidden phrases by guessing letters one at a time. Contestants win money or prizes, as determined by a spin of the wheel, for each correct consonant they guess. programme.title: Jeopardy!
programme.desc: "Jeopardy!" is a classic game show -- with a twist. The answers are given first, and the contestants supply the questions. Three contestants, including the previous show's champion, compete in six categories and in three rounds (with each round's "answers" being worth more prize money). In the third round, "Final Jeopardy," the contestants can name their own jackpot -- as long as it's within the amount of money they've already earned. If a player finishes the second round with zero dollars, they are eliminated from "Final Jeopardy." The first version of "Jeopardy!," which aired from 1964 to 1975 on NBC, was hosted by Art Fleming. Alex Trebek began with the program in 1984 (at the start of its syndicated run) and hosted until his death in 2020.

programme.title: Jeopardy!
programme.desc: "Jeopardy!" is a classic game show -- with a twist. The answers are given first, and the contestants supply the questions. Three contestants, including the previous show's champion, compete in six categories and in three rounds (with each round's "answers" being worth more prize money). In the third round, "Final Jeopardy," the contestants can name their own jackpot -- as long as it's within the amount of money they've already earned. If a player finishes the second round with zero dollars, they are eliminated from "Final Jeopardy." The first version of "Jeopardy!," which aired from 1964 to 1975 on NBC, was hosted by Art Fleming. Alex Trebek began with the program in 1984 (at the start of its syndicated run) and hosted until his death in 2020.

programme.desc: Hardie looks for the murderer of a man scheduled to receive a reward from Wells Fargo.

programme.title: Daniel Boone
programme.desc: A boy (Michael Burns), whose father was killed by Indians, faces the possible loss of his beloved horse.

programme.title: Laramie
programme.desc: Bob Blayne's sons come looking for Jess, bent on revenge because Jess maimed their father years ago; though Jess tries to avoid a shootout, when Slim is injured Jess is forced into action.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: Cheyenne gets an Indian to expose a phony hero and save a man's life.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: A band of Indians kidnaps Mark and disappears into the hills.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Lucas is the town's representative to the railroad commission until an infamous train robber dies and leaves his ill-gotten wealth to Lucas; Lucas must clear his name and stop the reckless ambition of his replacement.

programme.title: The High Chaparral
programme.desc: A miner closed down by Apache raids ignores John's objections and hires a bounty hunter.

programme.title: Wagon Train
programme.desc: Jenna Douglas appears to have been a victim of a scavenger attack and is adopted by the train; shortly after she joins, other riders begin to have doubts about her story.

programme.title: Wagon Train
programme.desc: A deathbed wish, Flint's foster mother sends him to find her son Artie, who Flint has struggled to get along with; when Flint finds him, he's been questionably elected mayor.

programme.title: Gunsmoke
programme.desc: A young woman tries to leave an outlaw gang behind so that she can start over.

programme.title: Laramie
programme.desc: Townsfolk are worried when a known hired killer arrives in Laramie and asks for directions to the Sherman ranch.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: Cheyenne faces a murder charge in a town bent on hanging him.

programme.title: The Virginian
programme.desc: A cowardly schoolteacher (George C. Scott) and his students are the hostages of two escaped convicts (Royal Dano, John David Chandler).

programme.title: Gunsmoke
programme.desc: Matt Dillon tries to protect a notorious gunman who is just out of prison and trying to go straight but keeps getting in trouble.

programme.title: Ride the High Country
programme.desc: Reduced to transporting gold from a distant mine to a small-town bank, retired lawman Steve Judd (Joel McCrea) recruits friend Gil Westrum (Randolph Scott), who has been performing in a traveling carnival. Unknown to Steve, the restless Gil and a young drifter intend to steal the next gold transport. On the way, the men help Elsa Knudsen (Mariette Hartley) to break free from her zealot father and join her fiance at the mine, not realizing the consequences that await them all.

programme.title: Wagon Train
programme.desc: Bill meets young Barnaby West, who is traveling to Sacramento to see his father.

programme.title: The Virginian
programme.desc: A young woman (Patty Duke), housekeeper to her father and brothers, goes west for adventure but ends up as a saloon waitress in Medicine Bow; guests Paul Carr, Tim McIntire.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Lucas and Mark set out on a hunting trip and stumble upon a robbery.

programme.title: Tales of Wells Fargo
programme.desc: Hardie puts his job on the line when he tries to help an outlaw go straight.

programme.title: Tales of Wells Fargo
programme.desc: Donlan gang wants to see Hardie dead.

programme.title: Laramie
programme.desc: Jess and the marshal hunt a band of outlaws, but after gunfire is exchanged, the gang leader suggests a prisoner exchange -- he'll give back the local man he's taken in exchange for Jess and the marshal.

programme.desc: With James Payne.

programme.desc: With Bishop Henry Fernandez.

programme.desc: With Dr. Mike Murdock.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Lucas is accidentally responsible for the death of a young mountain boy.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Lucas is stunned when Mark is kidnapped and a $5,000 ransom is asked.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Outlaws force Lucas to help with a prison break.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: A young girl asks refuge at the McCain ranch for herself and her ill brother.

programme.title: The High Chaparral
programme.desc: Temptation sidetracks Buck, Manolito and Billy Blue when they head for Tucson to buy supplies.

programme.title: The High Chaparral
programme.desc: Don Sebastian suspects a prank when Manolito and Billy Blue arrive to buy his second-best bull, so he has the animal stolen.

programme.title: Hangman's Knot
programme.desc: Major Matt Stewart (Randolph Scott) leads a troop of Confederate soldiers on a raid, targeting a wagon that is transporting Union gold. All of the Union soldiers are killed except for one, who informs Stewart that the war had already ended a month ago. Stewart leads the troop into hiding, knowing they could face murder charges. After capturing a coach driven by nurse Molly Hull (Donna Reed), the soldiers try to evade a group of bandits chasing them to steal the gold.

programme.title: The Stranger Wore a Gun
programme.desc: A man whose life was saved by an outlaw shows his gratitude by reluctantly assisting in a stagecoach robbery.

programme.title: Western Union
programme.desc: Engineer Edward Creighton (Dean Jagger) is part of a vast enterprise: stringing a telegraph line across America. When he has an accident in the field, Creighton is saved by bank robber Vance Shaw (Randolph Scott). Creighton later hires Shaw as a scout, despite his criminal past. As Western Union starts construction of the telegraph line through American Indian territory, Shaw's criminal past resurfaces when an old criminal cohort makes an appearance.

programme.title: Gunsmoke
programme.desc: A woman wants to adopt an orphaned baby, but Matt is suspicious of her husband.

programme.title: Gunsmoke
programme.desc: Doc Adams confesses to murder and asks to be arrested to maintain Matt's reputation.

programme.title: Gunsmoke
programme.desc: Kitty's Eastern suitor abandons her on the plains after she rejects him.

programme.title: Gunsmoke
programme.desc: Matt gets caught in the middle when an Ozark-mountain family feud comes to Dodge City.

programme.title: The Shadow Riders
programme.desc: Mac Traven (Tom Selleck) is a Civil War veteran who fought for the North, while his brother, Dal (Sam Elliott), was allied with the South. In spite of this considerable point of contention, the siblings must work together when they find that other family members have been abducted, along with Dal's girlfriend, Kate (Katharine Ross). Joined by their trouble-making uncle "Black Jack" (Ben Johnson), Mac and Dal relentlessly pursue the criminals to rescue their relatives.

programme.title: Tales of Wells Fargo

programme.title: Bonanza
programme.desc: Ben Cartwright is the patriarch of an all-male Nevada ranching family. Set during and after the Civil War, "Bonanza" is the story of life on the family's thousand-acre spread, known as the Ponderosa, near Virginia City. Ben has his three sons, each with a different (and deceased) mother. Serious eldest son Adam hopes to follow in his father's footsteps; middle son Hoss is a gentle giant -- physically strong, but sometimes naive; and youngest son Little Joe is the most impetuous and romantic of the offspring.

programme.title: Justice With Judge Mablean
programme.desc: Judge Mablean Ephriam, who presided over "Divorce Court" from 1999-2006 as the first star of the revived version of the show, returns to the courtroom genre with his half-hour series that deals with life and the law. The former Los Angeles-based prosecutor takes on the typical cases that are found on TV court shows. The arbitrator says that her show "will be life because everything we do, it involves the law."

programme.title: America's Court With Judge Ross
programme.desc: Americans just can't get enough courtroom drama, as is evidenced by yet another addition into the daytime court show fray. Former judge and prosecutor Kevin Ross adjudicates real cases, in which he tries to show litigants alternative ways of dealing with their issues and make them consider the consequences of their actions.

programme.title: The Verdict With Judge Hatchett
programme.desc: Judge Glenda Hatchett presided over her self-titled courtroom show from 2000-2008. Now, she returns to the medium with "The Verdict." In the half-hour series, the Atlanta native and former juvenile-court judge rules over small-claims cases brought in front of her. Hatchett's courtroom isn't just about finding someone guilty, though. She also uses her experience dealing with young people and her tough-love approach to help send a message to out-of-control juvenile offenders to try to set them on the right track in their lives.

programme.title: Supreme Justice With Judge Karen
programme.desc: Karen Mills was a county court judge and criminal defense attorney in Florida before turning to TV to preside over her own court shows. In her third effort, "Supreme Justice," Mills tackles small-claims court arbitrations in her compassionate way, to which viewers of her previous shows have grown accustomed. As usual with court shows, cases involve friendships gone bad, money disputes and property damage.

programme.title: The Verdict With Judge Hatchett
programme.desc: Judge Glenda Hatchett presided over her self-titled courtroom show from 2000-2008. Now, she returns to the medium with "The Verdict." In the half-hour series, the Atlanta native and former juvenile-court judge rules over small-claims cases brought in front of her. Hatchett's courtroom isn't just about finding someone guilty, though. She also uses her experience dealing with young people and her tough-love approach to help send a message to out-of-control juvenile offenders to try to set them on the right track in their lives.

programme.title: Supreme Justice With Judge Karen
programme.desc: Karen Mills was a county court judge and criminal defense attorney in Florida before turning to TV to preside over her own court shows. In her third effort, "Supreme Justice," Mills tackles small-claims court arbitrations in her compassionate way, to which viewers of her previous shows have grown accustomed. As usual with court shows, cases involve friendships gone bad, money disputes and property damage.

programme.title: Supreme Justice With Judge Karen

programme.title: Justice With Judge Mablean
programme.desc: Judge Mablean Ephriam, who presided over "Divorce Court" from 1999-2006 as the first star of the revived version of the show, returns to the courtroom genre with his half-hour series that deals with life and the law. The former Los Angeles-based prosecutor takes on the typical cases that are found on TV court shows. The arbitrator says that her show "will be life because everything we do, it involves the law."

programme.title: America's Court With Judge Ross
programme.desc: Americans just can't get enough courtroom drama, as is evidenced by yet another addition into the daytime court show fray. Former judge and prosecutor Kevin Ross adjudicates real cases, in which he tries to show litigants alternative ways of dealing with their issues and make them consider the consequences of their actions.

programme.title: Bone Collector
programme.desc: "Bone Collector" is one of the Outdoor Channel's most popular programs. Since premiering in 2009, the series has collected millions of fans by focusing on the culture of the hunter and not exclusively on the kill. According to host Michael Waddell, a hunter is more than a predator; a hunter is a provider, a caretaker, and a leader, and this show aims to promote that philosophy at every turn. Waddell is joined by co-hosts Nick Mundt and Travis "T-Bone" Turner for "warts and all" adventures that take them from Africa to Alaska, and the hunts are geared toward a variety of implements, including bow, muzzleloader, shotgun and rifle.

programme.title: Jim Shockey's Hunting Adventures
programme.desc: If it's an animal roaming the wild, Jim Shockey has probably hunted it. The veteran wilderness guide and outfitter has tracked game in more than 40 countries and taken in excess of 300 species using bow, muzzleloader and rifle. In addition, Shockey has exclusive guiding territories on Vancouver Island, in the Yukon Territory, in Mexico's Sonoran Desert, and in his native Saskatchewan, all of which helps supply content for the hunting adventures seen in this award-winning series. Jim's daughter Eva, a full-fledged hunter in her own right, joins her dad on many episodes.

programme.title: Bone Collector
programme.desc: "Bone Collector" is one of the Outdoor Channel's most popular programs. Since premiering in 2009, the series has collected millions of fans by focusing on the culture of the hunter and not exclusively on the kill. According to host Michael Waddell, a hunter is more than a predator; a hunter is a provider, a caretaker, and a leader, and this show aims to promote that philosophy at every turn. Waddell is joined by co-hosts Nick Mundt and Travis "T-Bone" Turner for "warts and all" adventures that take them from Africa to Alaska, and the hunts are geared toward a variety of implements, including bow, muzzleloader, shotgun and rifle.

programme.title: Paid Programming: Carshield -- Cars Have Changed
Silver Lode
programme.desc: A Nevada rancher (John Payne) is taken from his bride (Lizabeth Scott) by a killer (Dan Duryea) posing as a U.S. marshal on the Fourth of July.

programme.title: The Law and Jake Wade
programme.desc: Bandits Clint Hollister (Richard Widmark) and Jake Wade (Robert Taylor) botch a robbery that ends with Clint imprisoned. Despairing, Jake leaves the loot in an abandoned village and quits crime for good. Now working for the law, Jake helps free his old cohort from jail. Clint doesn't want the treasure to go to waste, however, so he forces Jake and his girlfriend, Peggy (Patricia Owens), to lead him to the stash. But to unearth the money, they'll have to get past dangerous Comanche warriors.

programme.title: The Violent Men
programme.desc: Former Union soldier John Parrish (Glenn Ford) wants to sell his ranch and start a new life by settling down out east. However, the ruthless tactics of Lew Wilkison (Edward G. Robinson), the scheming businessman interested in his property, make Parrish reconsider the move, especially after one of his ranch hands is murdered. Adding to the increasingly tense conflict is Wilkison's wife, Martha (Barbara Stanwyck), who is cheating on her husband with his brother, Cole (Brian Keith).

programme.title: In Harm's Way
programme.desc: Naval Captain Torrey (John Wayne) manages to bring his ship through the bombing of Pearl Harbor unscathed, but is later demoted when it is damaged in a subsequent battle due to his negligence. Back on land, he begins a reconciliation with his estranged son (Brandon de Wilde) and a romance with nurse Maggie (Patricia Neal), but duty calls him away when he and his firebrand friend, Cmdr. Paul Eddington (Kirk Douglas), are tasked with salvaging a dangerous and important mission.

programme.title: Big Jake
programme.desc: The avenging head of the McCandle clan returns to his estranged family and leads the search for his kidnapped grandson. Big Jake sets off, his sons in tow, to deliver the ransom to the kidnappers, but has little intention of handing it over without a fight.

programme.title: Hondo
programme.desc: An embittered Indian scout attempts to escort a homesteader's wife and her son back to safety after her cowardly husband deserts her during an Apache attack. When she refuses to go, the scout stays on to help for a while and, over time, forms a strong bond with both her and her son.

programme.title: Calamity Jane
programme.desc: In the lonely Deadwood, Dakota, territory, sharpshooter Calamity Jane (Doris Day) falls for cavalry Lt. Danny Gilmartin (Philip Carey) when she is forced to rescue him from the Indians. Recognizing that the women-starved townsmen long for a "real" woman, Calamity journeys to Chicago to bring back famous singer Adelaid Adams, but mistakenly brings her maid Katie instead. Heartbroken when Danny falls for Katie, Calamity all but ignores her jovial friend Wild Bill Hickok (Howard Keel).

programme.title: Day of the Evil Gun
programme.desc: Returning home after disappearing three years ago, former gunslinger Lorn Warfield (Glenn Ford) finds that an Apache raiding party has kidnapped his wife and children. Though he has renounced violence, he now takes up his gun and joins forces with his neighbor, Owen Forbes (Arthur Kennedy). Complicating matters, Forbes is engaged to Warfield's wife, who believed her husband was dead. As they pursue the Apaches, the two men are joined by an Indian trader, Jimmy Noble (Dean Jagger).

programme.title: The Range Feud
programme.desc: When a murder occurs during a range war, a sheriff (Buck Jones) investigates to clear an innocent man (John Wayne).

programme.title: The Fatal Mallet
programme.desc: Three men play dirty tricks to charm a beautiful young woman.

programme.title: The Adventures of Sherlock Holmes
programme.desc: Holmes is called in when a top secret document is stolen from the British Foreign Office.

programme.title: The Life and Legend of Wyatt Earp
programme.desc: Earp rides to Oklahoma in search of a killer who stabbed his cousin Nate and volunteers to join a group of cattle drivers, one of whom owns a knife similar to the murder weapon.

programme.title: Outlaw Women
programme.desc: A gambling queen (Marie Windsor) and her henchwomen run things until a U.S. marshal (Richard Rober) comes to town.

programme.title: Kit Carson
programme.desc: At Fort Bridger in the Wyoming Territory, frontiersman and scout Kit Carson (Jon Hall) receives a request to guide a wagon train over the Oregon Trail to California. Concerned by the dangers of Indian attacks, Carson hesitates, but then agrees despite the wagon train having already arranged for protection from a cavalry unit led by Capt. John Fremont (Dana Andrews). On the journey, Caron and Fremont clash several times over leadership -- and the attentions of Dolores Murphy (Lynn Bari).

programme.title: The Harvey Girls
programme.desc: When Susan Bradley (Judy Garland) responded to an ad in New Mexico for a mail-order bride, she had no idea that her would-be husband was a broken-down cowhand. Instead of returning back home, she takes a job at the local Harvey House restaurant. But the new establishment faces tough resistance from the local saloon owner (John Hodiak) and the town's streetwise showgirl, Em (Angela Lansbury). As Susan works with the Harvey girls to win over the townsfolk, she also searches for a new love.

programme.title: On Golden Pond
programme.desc: Cantankerous retiree Norman Thayer (Henry Fonda) and his conciliatory wife, Ethel (Katharine Hepburn), spend summers at their New England vacation home on the shores of idyllic Golden Pond. This year, their adult daughter, Chelsea (Jane Fonda), visits with her new fiancée and his teenage son, Billy (Doug McKeon) on their way to Europe. After leaving Billy behind to bond with Norman, Chelsea returns, attempting to repair the long-strained relationship with her aging father before it's too late.

programme.title: I Married a Witch
programme.desc: Just as she is about to be burned at the stake for witchcraft, 17th century witch Jennifer (Veronica Lake) casts a curse on the family of her accuser, dooming all the men of future generations to marry the wrong women. Freed from her ethereal prison some 250 years later, Jennifer decides to make the most recent descendant of her accuser (Fredric March) even more miserable by using a love potion on him that makes him fall in love with her, a plan that has unexpected results.

programme.title: Little Big Horn
programme.desc: Captain Phillip Donlin (Lloyd Bridges) and his small troop must rush to reach Little Big Horn in order to warn General Custer of the Sioux attack that awaits him. As they race against time, and Donlin pushes them hard through an arduous and dangerous journey, the Sioux start taking out the soldiers one at a time. Meanwhile, Donlin also clashes with Lt. John Haywood (John Ireland), who Donlin knows is having an affair with his wife, Celie (Marie Windsor).

programme.desc: Three escaped convicts return to collect the money that the brother of one of them has already spent.

programme.title: The Cisco Kid in Old New Mexico
programme.desc: The Cisco Kid (Duncan Renaldo) and Pancho (Martin Garralaga) free a girl (Gwen Kenyon) accused of murder, then find the killer.

programme.title: Montana
programme.desc: Aussie shepherd Morgan Lane (Errol Flynn) moves all the way to Montana in hopes of finding the perfect terrain for raising his sheep, but the local ranchers aren't keen on sharing their land with outsiders. Before long, Morgan clashes with powerful cattleman Rodney Ackroyd, and their rivalry is only intensified when Ackroyd's fiancée, Maria (Alexis Smith), has eyes for Morgan. However, her sympathies still lie with her lover, and it seems that only a gunfight can settle the conflict.

programme.title: Dodge City
programme.desc: In 1872, Dodge City, Kansas is the epicenter of cattle drives and lawlessness. Run by Jeff Surrett (Bruce Cabot), Dodge City isn't safe for anyone or anything. When Wade Hatton (Errol Flynn) arrives for a cattle drive, he's moved by the violent death of a young boy to take up the post of sheriff and take back the town from Surrett and his cohorts. But first he must contend with the rowdy townsfolk who, having been so long without law, desire to take the law into their own hands.

programme.title: Indiscreet
programme.desc: Famous theater actress Anna Kalman (Ingrid Bergman) has resigned herself to her single life, believing that she has missed her chance at meeting a husband. Weary of socializing in Europe, she returns to her London flat, where her sister Margaret (Phyllis Calvert) and diplomat brother-in-law Alfred (Cecil Parker) invite her to a banquet. She demurs until Alfred's banker friend, Philip Adams (Cary Grant), arrives and a flirtation begins. Their romance blossoms -- but he's already married.

programme.title: An Affair to Remember
programme.desc: A man and a woman have a romance while on a cruise from Europe to New York. Despite being engaged to other people, both agree to reunite at the top of the Empire State Building in six months. However, an unfortunate accident keeps her from the reunion, and he fears that she has married or does not love him anymore.

programme.title: The Barefoot Contessa
programme.desc: Washed-up film director Harry Dawes (Humphrey Bogart) gets a second chance at stardom when he discovers stunning peasant Maria Vargas (Ava Gardner) dancing in a nightclub in Madrid, Spain. Goaded by his producer, strong-arming Wall Street financier Kirk Edwards (Warren Stevens), Harry convinces her to screen test for, and then star in, his next big picture. But as Edwards' possessive nature and the realities of stardom weigh on Maria, she seeks a genuine lover with whom she can escape.

programme.title: Holiday
programme.desc: Johnny (Cary Grant) seems like a solid match for Julia (Doris Nolan), the socialite daughter of Edward Seton (Henry Kolker). Assured that Johnny is a worthy suitor, Edward approves of the pairing. But, as Johnny's wanderlust surfaces -- he is more interested in traveling than in business -- Edward starts to have doubts. Johnny also begins to wonder if he might not be a better match for Linda (Katharine Hepburn), Julia's outspoken younger sister, with whom he has much more in common.

programme.title: Miss Annie Rooney
programme.desc: Teenager Annie Rooney (Shirley Temple) chafes at the lack of attention from her distracted boyfriend, Joey (Roland Dupree). One evening on the way to a party, Joey rear-ends the car of wealthy Marty White Jr. (Dickie Moore). Smitten, Annie accepts a ride from Marty to the party, where she delights him by teaching him to jitterbug. Annie begins dating Marty, but she is brought up short when his family refuses to invite her to his birthday party because of her working-class, eccentric father.

After saving a man (William Ching) from a vicious attack, Larry learns hen is actually Corinna's new husband, and that some of the locals are preparing to challenge Tucker's land ownership. When Larry decides to ride back into town and make a claim himself, he encounters a few unexpected obstacles.

programme.title: The Valley of Decision
programme.desc: An Irish maid, Mary Rafferty (Greer Garson), falls for Paul (Gregory Peck), who is the son of her rich boss, William Scott (Donald Crisp). To further complicate matters, Mary's father, Pat (Lionel Barrymore), lost both of his legs in an accident at the steel mill owned by Paul's father. Neither William nor Pat approves of the couple's romance, and the burgeoning relationship only becomes a bigger battleground when a strike erupts at the steel mill.

programme.title: The Rainmaker
programme.desc: During the Great Depression, a drought is wreaking havoc on a small, destitute Kansas town. Bill Starbuck (Burt Lancaster), a slick grifter, arrives in town, promising he can make it rain in exchange for $100. His offer is accepted by H. C. Curry (Cameron Prudhomme), a rancher whose spinster daughter, Lizzie (Katharine Hepburn), is desperate for a suitor. Lizzie finally finds confidence when Starbuck, ever the smooth talker, convinces her she's beautiful.

programme.title: Think Big
programme.desc: Children are the future -- and so are their inventions, which is why "Think Big" could be an important show. It features young inventors competing to see who can come up with the most-innovative invention. Each episode features two teams in the Think Tank -- a studio filled with art supplies and construction materials -- who brainstorm and choose materials before sketching, designing and building a prototype to be presented to a judge, who determines a winner. The champions earn bragging rights and the coveted Genius Cup.

programme.title: Biz Kids
programme.desc: Teaching financial education and entrepreneurship to a preteen audience; using sketch comedy and young actors to explain basic economic concepts.

programme.title: Sports Stars of Tomorrow
programme.desc: Profiles of the top rookie, college and high-school talent in sports; current athletes share their experiences, advice and personal impressions of the road to stardom.

programme.title: America's Heartland
programme.desc: Much of the food Americans eat is produced by farmers and ranchers in the country's heartland, but many people don't know how it's produced. "America's Heartland" provides information about the people and processes responsible for the availability of food and fuel across the country and around the world. The show's reporters and producers tell stories in topics that include farm families, consumer issues, animal welfare and crop sustainability. Some episodes also take the show abroad to countries such as Egypt and Taiwan to show the impact American agriculture has on the global economy.

programme.title: Git Along, Little Dogies
programme.desc: To protect his land from the possibility of pollution, ranch owner Gene Autry (Gene Autry) sides with fellow ranchers who are fighting the plans of banker Maxwell (William Farnum), who wants to drill oil wells. But when Gene realizes the discovery of oil would bring a railroad to the area and create much-needed jobs, he switches sides. Conniving local businessman George Wilkins (Weldon Heyburn) turns investors against Gene and Maxwell, however, hoping to slip in and take over the oil business.

programme.title: Gun Fury
programme.desc: (1953) Western. Rock Hudson stars as a California-bound settler who must ride 1500 miles to the Mexican border to rescue his fiancée (Donna Reed) after she's abducted by an outlaw.

programme.title: Shenandoah
programme.desc: (1965) Western. James Stewart stars as a wealthy Virginia farming patriarch trying to keep his family together and safe in the midst of the encroaching American Civil War.

programme.title: Journey to the Center of the Earth
programme.desc: (1959) Fantasy adventure starring James Mason, Pat Boone and Diane Baker. An expedition to the centre of the planet unexpectedly encounters a villainous rival and prehistoric beasts.

programme.title: Moon
programme.desc: (2009) Psychological sci-fi thriller. Sam Rockwell stars as a man who lives alone on the moon overseeing a mining operation. His time's nearly done, but he's started to go a bit peculiar...

programme.title: Kingsman: The Secret Service
programme.desc: (2014) Action-comedy with Colin Firth, Taron Egerton and Samuel L Jackson. A London teenager is introduced to a secret society of immaculately dressed agents that exists to save the world.

programme.title: Bone Tomahawk
programme.desc: (2016) Wild West horror starring Kurt Russell, Lili Simmons, Patrick Wilson, Richard Jenkins and Matthew Fox. Can a posse save townsfolk from their cannibalistic abductors?

programme.title: Slow West
programme.desc: (2015) Violent offbeat western starring Kodi Smit-McPhee and Michael Fassbender. A 16-year-old Scottish lad travels to 1870s Colorado on the trail of his true love.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Roman Holiday
programme.desc: (1953) Audrey Hepburn won her only Oscar in this romance as a bored princess who runs away from her duties and meets an American journalist (Gregory Peck), who shows her Rome.

programme.title: Local Hero
programme.desc: (1983) Comedy starring Peter Riegert, Burt Lancaster and Peter Capaldi. A US oil company executive tries to persuade a small Scottish seaside community to sell up their entire village.

programme.title: Hidden Figures
programme.desc: (2016) Taraji P. Henson, Octavia Spencer and Janelle Monáe star in the Oscar-nominated, fact-based drama about three women whose genius made a significant contribution to the space race.

programme.title: Midway
programme.desc: (2019) Roland Emmerich's sprawling, action-packed war drama about the Battle of Midway, a major turning point in World War II. Starring Ed Skrein, Luke Evans and Woody Harrelson.

programme.title: Censor Interview Special
programme.desc: Star Niamh Algar and director Prano Bailey-Bond talk about making their new psychological horror film, Censor.

programme.title: Braveheart
programme.desc: (1995) Mel Gibson stars in this Oscar-laden epic as William Wallace - Scottish freedom fighter, rousing orator and keen face painter - who led his army into England, threatening the throne.

programme.title: Censor
programme.desc: (2021) Prano Bailey-Bond's subtle horror with Niamh Algar. Things get personal for a film censor who harbours unresolved family trauma, working during the video nasties panic of the 1980s.

programme.title: The Craft: Legacy
programme.desc: (2020) Supernatural thriller and standalone sequel to 1996's The Craft. A teenager discovers that she has magical abilities. But they come with dangerous consequences.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Hail the Conquering Hero
programme.desc: (1944) Satirical wartime comedy starring Eddie Bracken as a man who becomes a celebrated war hero despite having been medically discharged from the marines after only a few weeks.

programme.title: Monster House
programme.desc: (2006) Spooky animated caper with Maggie Gyllenhaal and Steve Buscemi. A young boy and his babysitter spy on the creepy neighbour. Did he really eat his wife?

programme.title: Jason and the Argonauts
programme.desc: (1963) Classic interpretation of the Greek myth of Jason's quest to find the Golden Fleece, boasting the enduring work of special effects maestro Ray Harryhausen. Directed by Don Chaffey.

programme.title: Stormbreaker
programme.desc: (2006) Family action-thriller with Alex Pettyfer and Mickey Rourke. British intelligence recruit a schoolboy to take on the man who killed his dad and is planning to unleash a deadly virus.

programme.title: Gemini Man
programme.desc: (2019) Will Smith stars in Ang Lee's action-thriller as both an over-the-hill hitman and the young clone of himself sent to take him out. With Clive Owen.

programme.title: Daredevil
programme.desc: (2003) Superhero fantasy. Ben Affleck is a blind lawyer who turns vigilante by night. Jennifer Garner plays his lover and Colin Farrell the villain who endangers them both. Strong violence.

programme.title: Ghost Rider
programme.desc: (2007) Nicolas Cage is Marvel's soul-hunting, hot-headed-biker antihero. When Mephistopheles's son starts causing trouble in hell, Ghost Rider is forced to sort it out. With Peter Fonda.

programme.title: Riders of Justice
programme.desc: (2020) Darkly comic thriller with Mads Mikkelsen. A soldier recruits three geeks to help him hunt down his wife's killer. In Danish/subs.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: LumoTV: Deaf Jams: Rhythm and...
programme.desc: ...Lyrics: Rapper MC Geezer teams up with drum 'n' bass icon Harry Shotta as best mates Luke and Lisa chase their dream.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: The Devil at 4 O'Clock
programme.desc: (1961) Drama. Spencer Tracy stars as an unfairly unpopular priest living on a volcanic South Sea island which is about to erupt. With Kerwin Matthews, Frank Sinatra and Barbara Luna.

programme.title: Censor Interview Special
programme.desc: Star Niamh Algar and director Prano Bailey-Bond talk about making their new psychological horror film, Censor.

programme.title: The Violent Men
programme.desc: (1955) Cold War-influenced western starring Glenn Ford and Edward G Robinson. A smallholder stands alone against the expansionist plans and brutal tactics of a tyrannical rancher.

programme.title: Arabesque
programme.desc: (1966) Gregory Peck stars in Stanley Donen's spy thriller. An Oxford professor is unwittingly drawn into a deadly web of political intrigue. With Sophia Loren and Alan Badel.

programme.title: Censor Interview Special
programme.desc: Star Niamh Algar and director Prano Bailey-Bond talk about making their new psychological horror film, Censor.

programme.title: Le Mans '66
programme.desc: (2019) Oscar-winning sports drama starring Matt Damon and Christian Bale. In the 60s, Ford set out to build a car that can defeat Ferrari at the 24 Hours of Le Mans race.

programme.title: Knock at the Cabin
programme.desc: (2023) M Night Shyamalan's jarringly intimate end-of-days horror with Dave Bautista. An armed group insist that a family of three must make an impossible life-or-death choice.

programme.title: Chevalier
programme.desc: (2022) Exuberant historical costume drama. Kelvin Harrison Jr stars as prodigiously talented French-Caribbean swordsman and composer Joseph Bologne, who literally out-fiddled Mozart.

programme.title: Blue Bayou
programme.desc: (2021) Justin Chon's poignant drama about a man of Korean descent who is threatened with deportation from the US even though he was adopted into an American family when he was three.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Santa Fe
programme.desc: (1951) Western starring Randolph Scott. Four brothers leave the defeated South to seek jobs as the US recovers from the Civil War. As one becomes a railwayman, the others turn to crime.

programme.title: The Black Arrow
programme.desc: (1948) Historical adventure. A man (Louis Hayward) returns from the Wars of the Roses to learn from his uncle that a family friend has killed his father. But is everything as it seems?

programme.title: To Hell and Back
programme.desc: (1955) Fact-based wartime drama. Audie Murphy, America's most decorated soldier in WWII, plays himself in this dramatic recreation of the valiant heroics that earned him the honours.

programme.title: Censor Interview Special
programme.desc: Star Niamh Algar and director Prano Bailey-Bond talk about making their new psychological horror film, Censor.

programme.title: Canyon Passage
programme.desc: (1946) Frontier western starring Dana Andrews. An ambitious businessman journeys to rural Oregon where a complex web of life and love waits to ensnare him. Directed by Jacques Tourneur.

programme.title: Legends of the Fall
programme.desc: (1994) Oscar-winning turn-of-the-century drama with Brad Pitt and Anthony Hopkins. A Montana patriarch's son falls for his brother's fiancée, setting off a tragic chain of events.

programme.title: A Man Called Otto
programme.desc: (2022) Darkly-tinged but ultimately feel-good comedy starring Tom Hanks as a grumpy misanthrope who spends his time badgering people into following society's rules. But why is he like this?

programme.title: Our Kind of Traitor
programme.desc: (2014) Thriller about a British couple who get drawn into a Russian mafia conspiracy. With Ewan McGregor, Naomie Harris, Stellan Skarsgård and Damian Lewis. Based on John le Carré's novel.

programme.title: Night of the 12th
programme.desc: (2022) Award-winning, gritty true-crime drama following a faltering police investigation into the grisly murder of a young woman. With Bastien Bouillon and Bouli Lanners. In French/subs.

programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: Join the Loose Women panellists as they interview celebrity guests and discuss the day's most topical issues, from current affairs to celebrity gossip and the latest showbiz news.

programme.title: ITV Lunchtime News
programme.desc: The latest headlines from around the world at lunchtime with reports and analysis from ITV's Correspondents, all of which are followed by a national weather forecast.

programme.title: ITV News London
programme.desc: The latest news and weather from London and the South East.

programme.title: New: Dickinson's Real Deal
programme.desc: Port Sunlight 4: David Dickinson and his team of dealers are in Port Sunlight on the Wirral in Merseyside as a massive music hall memorabilia collection makes David all nostalgic. S20 Ep20

programme.title: New: Time is Money

programme.title: Gun Fury
programme.desc: (1953) Western. Rock Hudson stars as a California-bound settler who must ride 1500 miles to the Mexican border to rescue his fiancée (Donna Reed) after she's abducted by an outlaw.

programme.title: Shenandoah
programme.desc: (1965) Western. James Stewart stars as a wealthy Virginia farming patriarch trying to keep his family together and safe in the midst of the encroaching American Civil War.

programme.title: Journey to the Center of the Earth
programme.desc: (1959) Fantasy adventure starring James Mason, Pat Boone and Diane Baker. An expedition to the centre of the planet unexpectedly encounters a villainous rival and prehistoric beasts.

programme.title: Moon
programme.desc: (2009) Psychological sci-fi thriller. Sam Rockwell stars as a man who lives alone on the moon overseeing a mining operation. His time's nearly done, but he's started to go a bit peculiar...

programme.title: Kingsman: The Secret Service
programme.desc: (2014) Action-comedy with Colin Firth, Taron Egerton and Samuel L Jackson. A London teenager is introduced to a secret society of immaculately dressed agents that exists to save the world.

programme.title: Bone Tomahawk
programme.desc: (2016) Wild West horror starring Kurt Russell, Lili Simmons, Patrick Wilson, Richard Jenkins and Matthew Fox. Can a posse save townsfolk from their cannibalistic abductors?

programme.title: Slow West
programme.desc: (2015) Violent offbeat western starring Kodi Smit-McPhee and Michael Fassbender. A 16-year-old Scottish lad travels to 1870s Colorado on the trail of his true love.

programme.title: Roman Holiday
programme.desc: (1953) Audrey Hepburn won her only Oscar in this romance as a bored princess who runs away from her duties and meets an American journalist (Gregory Peck), who shows her Rome.

programme.title: Local Hero
programme.desc: (1983) Comedy starring Peter Riegert, Burt Lancaster and Peter Capaldi. A US oil company executive tries to persuade a small Scottish seaside community to sell up their entire village.

programme.title: Hidden Figures
programme.desc: (2016) Taraji P. Henson, Octavia Spencer and Janelle Monáe star in the Oscar-nominated, fact-based drama about three women whose genius made a significant contribution to the space race.

programme.title: Midway
programme.desc: (2019) Roland Emmerich's sprawling, action-packed war drama about the Battle of Midway, a major turning point in World War II. Starring Ed Skrein, Luke Evans and Woody Harrelson.

programme.title: Censor Interview Special
programme.desc: Star Niamh Algar and director Prano Bailey-Bond talk about making their new psychological horror film, Censor.

programme.title: Braveheart
programme.desc: (1995) Mel Gibson stars in this Oscar-laden epic as William Wallace - Scottish freedom fighter, rousing orator and keen face painter - who led his army into England, threatening the throne.

programme.title: Censor
programme.desc: (2021) Prano Bailey-Bond's subtle horror with Niamh Algar. Things get personal for a film censor who harbours unresolved family trauma, working during the video nasties panic of the 1980s.

programme.title: The Craft: Legacy
programme.desc: (2020) Supernatural thriller and standalone sequel to 1996's The Craft. A teenager discovers that she has magical abilities. But they come with dangerous consequences.

programme.title: Daredevil
